p: Many interacting processes control the concentrations of O 3 and PM at a given location: emissions, transport, transformation and deposition, all of which can be affected directly or indirectly by meteorology and climate. O 3 has an average tropospheric lifetime of about a month [ 11]. The different components of PM have varying lifetimes but typical values are around ~1–2 weeks [ 12]. Horizontal transport times across the mid-latitudes are ~2 weeks [ 13], hence both O 3 and PM can be transported across continents.
